head.title: Covid-19 and School Closure Resource Center – Parents & Students – Buhler Unified School District 313

meta.name: description
meta.content: Buhler Unified School District 313 serves K-12th grade students and is located in Buhler, KS.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Buhler Unified School District 313, Buhler, Kansas, USD 313

nav.a: Covid-19 and School Closure Resource Center

img.h1: Covid-19 and School Closure Resource Center

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The Continuous Learning Plan is the plan that all districts are creating to allow Kansas students to continue learning even though the buildings are closed. School districts across Kansas are putting CLPs in place to ensure the continuous education of their students. Plans will vary in each district across the state. Educators will develop essential outcomes and create plans for their students to meet these essential outcomes. Students may learn through various virtual platforms (Seesaw, Google Classroom, Flipgrid) and/or paper assignments. We have identified the learning management and parent communication systems for all grades, as well as the maximum time students should spending working on learning tasks each day. Continue below for resources to help you with the technology and an FAQ section.

object.title: Continuous Learning Expectations
object.p: It appears you don't have a PDF plugin for this browser. Please download the PDF file.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Below are some links to resources to help you understand the technology platforms your student will be using. Your teacher may be switching from a platform they have used all year. This is so that we can simplify communication across the district and prevent parents needing to check so many platforms if multiple students are in the district.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: Parent's Guide to Google Classroom Video

a.span: Getting Started with Flipgrid for Students Video

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Who qualifies for the daily lunch and breakfast program?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Anyone between the ages of 1 and 18 may receive a free lunch and a breakfast for the following day. These meals will be available Monday-Friday from 11:00 to 12:00 at either Union Valley Elementary School or Buhler High School. Any student receiving a lunch must be present.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Does my child need a technology device to complete school work?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Students in grades 3-12 will be provided school-issued devices that they have been using on a daily basis in their classrooms. Depending on the number of devices needed for PreK-2nd grade students, the district

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: divide out the remaining devices to PreK-2nd grade families who do not have devices available at home.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: How will we receive a school-issued device and what will the device be?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Students in grades 3-12 will be able to pick up their devices and chargers when their personal supplies are picked up on Thursday, March 26 or Friday, March 27. K-2 students who have no device at home and

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will the Continuous Learning Plan mean my child is on a device all day?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No. The time recommendations for students’ learning in this model vary from a typical school day.

p.span: 90 minutes

td.style: border: 1pt solid #000000; vertical-align: top; padding: 5pt; overflow: hidden; overflow-wrap: break-word

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

td.style: border: 1pt solid #000000; vertical-align: top; padding: 5pt; overflow: hidden; overflow-wrap: break-word

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: 30 minutes per class (maximum of 3 hours total)

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: These minutes could include work on a device as well as work on paper or on hands-on learning projects.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: What if I do not have internet access at home?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Buhler 313 is working with local providers to see if there are ways to provide internet access to families who currently do not have it. Ideatek, for example, is working on offering “drive-in” wifi in parking lots. Starting March 23, the following locations will have access points installed near parking stalls or lots where users can get online from the comfort of their vehicles and still practice social distancing. More locations will be added in days to come. To stay updated visit our Public Wifi Resource Page

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Buhler: IdeaTek, 111 Old Mill Street

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Buhler: Buhler City Library, 121 N. Main

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hutchinson: Prairie Hills Middle School

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Do I need to find my own resources to teach my child since the school building is closed?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: There is no need to purchase or acquire resources or a device to teach your child. Your child’s teacher will be providing you with the resources and strategies your child needs to learn and be successful. However, you are more than welcome to promote learning as you see fit.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: I’ve heard that kids might be able to come to school in small groups of less than 10. Is that going to happen in Buhler?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Currently, our BOE and Reno County Health Department is allowing small groups of less than 10 to gather. All individuals must remain at least 6’ apart.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will my child's teacher be available during the day for me or my student to get help?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

br.span: Yes, each teacher has been asked to designate 2 "office" hours. These may be split up and can take place any time between 8:00 am and 9:00 pm. Teachers will be communicating these to students and parents.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will my child be able to get things from their locker or classroom?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Yes, each building is creating a schedule and plan for students to come and pick up supplies, including items left in their desks/lockers, devices, and medication/supplies from the nurse. Supplies will be available for pick-up on Thursday, March 26 and Friday, March 27. Please watch for communication from your child’s specific building about this process.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: When can I expect teachers to contact my child?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Buhler 313 staff will be working the week of March 23-27 to plan and organize learning for your child.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: When can I expect my child to begin school work under the Continuous Learning Plan?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Staff will be organizing and working on their plans the week of March 23-27. Students and families should expect to start their learning on March 30.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: As a parent/guardian, what should I do to support my child in this Continuous Learning Plan model?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: As a parent/guardian, you are a critical part of this plan’s success. Although this is a new way of learning, it is crucial that students and families are receptive to this new and different style of teaching and learning. If you have ideas or suggestions, please give feedback to your child’s teachers and administrators. Most importantly, give everyone grace- your child, your child’s teacher and administration, and yourself. We understand the challenges many families face with working parents, siblings who may have to care for younger siblings, and inadequate access to the internet. We ask that you make every effort to ensure your child is able to finish the work and please reach out and communicate to your child’s teacher.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Who do I contact if I have questions or concerns?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: You may contact your child’s teacher and if they are unable to answer they will direct you to the building principal.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: Will school offices be open? Will the BAC be open?

span.style: font-size: 18pt; font-family: 'Crimson Text', serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: School buildings are not open to the public and offices are not operational. The Burkholder Administrative Center will be closed to the public but will continue to receive mail and critical business operations will still function.

br.style: font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-size-adjust: auto; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; caret-color: #000000; color: #000000

a.span: Covid-19 and School Closure Resource Center
